ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.vdisk

Interface IVirtualFile

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<IVirtualDiskEntry>, IVirtualDiskEntry
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    VirtualFile

    public interface IVirtualFile
extends IVirtualDiskEntry
    Represents a file on the virtual disk.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getDataDiskSize()
      Returns the actual disk space used to store this files data.
      long getDataPosition()
      Returns the offset of the first block of the file data in the virtual disk.
      long getFilePointer()
      Returns the current offset in this file.
      long getSize()
      Returns the size of this file.
      byte read()
      Reads a signed eight-bit value from the file at the current offset.
      int read(byte[] b)
      Reads up to b.length bytes of bytes from the file into an array of bytes starting at the current offset.
      void seek(long position)
      Sets the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the file.
      void setSize(long newSize)
      Sets the size of this file.
      void write(byte b)
      Writes the specified byte to the file at the current offset.
      void write(byte[] b)
      Write the specified byte array to the file at the current offset.

    • Method Detail

      • getFilePointer

        long getFilePointer()
                    throws IOException
        Returns the current offset in this file.
        Returns:
        the offset from the beginning of the file, in bytes, at which the next read or write occurs.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • getDataPosition

        long getDataPosition()
                     throws IOException
        Returns the offset of the first block of the file data in the virtual disk.
        Returns:
        the offset of the first block of the file in bytes.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • seek

        void seek(long position)
          throws IOException
        Sets the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the file. The offset may be set beyond the end of the file. Setting the offset beyond the end of the file does not change the file length. The file length will change only by writing after the offset has been set beyond the end of the file.
        Parameters:
        position - the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        int read(byte[] b)
         throws IOException
        Reads up to b.length bytes of bytes from the file into an array of bytes starting at the current offset.
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is read.
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes written into b
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • read

        byte read()
          throws IOException
        Reads a signed eight-bit value from the file at the current offset.
        Returns:
        the next byte of the disk space.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • write

        void write(byte b)
           throws IOException
        Writes the specified byte to the file at the current offset.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • write

        void write(byte[] b)
           throws IOException
        Write the specified byte array to the file at the current offset.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • setSize

        void setSize(long newSize)
             throws IOException
        Sets the size of this file. If the present size of the file as returned by the size method is greater than the newSize argument then the file will be truncated. If the present size of the file as returned by the size method is smaller than the newSize argument then the file will be extended. In this case, the contents of the extended portion of the file are not defined.
        Parameters:
        newSize - the desired size of the file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getSize

        long getSize()
             throws IOException
        Returns the size of this file.
        Returns:
        the size of this file, measured in bytes.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getDataDiskSize

        long getDataDiskSize()
                     throws IOException
        Returns the actual disk space used to store this files data.
        Returns:
        the disk space used to store this file, measured in bytes.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
